node.contents: I'm trying to make a program that will ask for a number of people to go into an ArrayList and then pick a name out of it randomly. The code is working fine but the string asking for name input displays itself twice the first time you run it. Any clue why this happens?

astNode.text: I'm trying to make a program that will ask for a number of people to go into an ArrayList and then pick a name out of it randomly. The code is working fine but the string asking for name input displays itself twice the first time you run it. Any clue why this happens?

node.contents: What I want it to display: Enter a name: ......

astNode.text: What I want it to display: Enter a name: ......

node.contents: What it displays: Enter a name: Enter a name: ......

astNode.text: What it displays: Enter a name: Enter a name: ......

units.rawText:
import java.util.*; class RandomNumGen { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in); Random random = new Random(); ArrayList<String> names = new ArrayList<String>(); int a, b; System.out.print("
Enter the number of people: "); a = input.nextInt(); System.out.println(); for (int i = 0; i <= a; i++) { System.out.print("Enter a name: "); names.add(input.nextLine()); } b = random.nextInt(a); System.out.print("
Random name: "+names.get(b)+ "
"); } }

node.contents: The issue is that nextInt() just consumes an integer, but not the new-line character inputted when you press Enter.

astNode.text: The issue is that nextInt() just consumes an integer, but not the new-line character inputted when you press Enter.
